Triggering Event: A student, oblivious to her surroundings, slams his locker door inches from where she's standing, startling her and causing her to spill her tea, staining her favorite cardigan.
Generated Assessment: She's so careless! I'm such a mess now. This is going to ruin my day. And why did he have to slam that door? He doesn't even know me. It was probably an accident anyway, but noooo, it had to be on purpose just for me. Why does this always happen to me? I'll never get over this stain. My favorite cardigan is ruined because of him. He must think he's funny or something. I hate how awkward this is making everyone look. Everyone's staring at us. Why can't they see how rude he was? Don't they care about people like me who are already stressed out enough? They're all so unforgiving. I bet if I told them what really happened, they'd still treat me poorly. They wouldn't understand. The whole school is against me. Even my friends don't want to sit with me anymore because of this stupid stain. Now I feel like a total loser. I wish I could go home right now. I'm done with school today. This isn't fair. I deserve better than this. But no, life has to make me suffer. I'm just too clumsy for everyone else. I shouldn't even be here. I'm ruining everything for everyone. Why does this keep happening to me?

Triggering Event: A man in his fifties, seated alone at the kitchen table, pushes away the half-eaten dinner his wife prepared. He stares at the empty chair across from him, where their grown son used to sit. His eyes well up as he looks at the framed photograph of them together in uniform, now gathering dust. The house is too quiet tonight; his son's laughter echoing absentmindedly in his mind. He takes a sip of cold coffee, grimacing at its bitterness.
Generated Assessment: He fucking shouldn't have pushed it away. It should've been left untouched for his son to come home to. Shouldn't he have sat down next to his father instead of going out with friends? That's what fathers were supposed to do. Shouldn't our family be more intact? Shouldn't I have cooked something else so he wouldn't feel like leaving? Shouldn't he still be living here? Shouldn't we have tried harder to keep him? Shouldn't I have called him sooner? Shouldn't he have listened? Shouldn't he have stayed closer to home? Shouldn't I have been more understanding when he got into trouble? Shouldn't he have been there for me when I needed help? Shouldn't I have been more patient with him? Shouldn't he have taken responsibility for his actions? It doesn't fucking make sense. We're supposed to be better than this. Shouldn't I have been able to stop him from leaving? Shouldn't he have listened to reason? Shouldn't I have reached out sooner? Shouldn't he have stayed? Shouldn't I have been there for him? Shouldn't he have felt safer coming home? Shouldn't I have been more supportive? Shouldn't he have trusted me? Shouldn't I have been stronger? Shouldn't he have fought harder to stay? Shouldn't I have been more present? Shouldn't he have seen things differently? # Response

Triggering Event: She opens her mailbox, already heavy-hearted from another lonely weekend. Inside is a Christmas card addressed to both of them, from her ex-husband's new family.
Generated Assessment: She was expecting me to be there for her. Instead, she went out with him. How could this have happened? It feels like such an act of betrayal, especially after everything we’ve been through together. He must think he can just replace me with someone else so easily? Why does it feel like she doesn’t even care about how I’m feeling right now? Doesn’t she know how much I’ve struggled lately? Does she really think I’ll just forget all our shared memories because she wants to spend time with him? This isn’t fair. We were supposed to support each other during this difficult period. Now, she chooses to ignore my feelings and focus on what she wants instead of being there for me when I need her most. What kind of person does that? Doesn’t she understand that I thought we had something real? I gave up so much for her, and now this? It feels like she’s intentionally trying to hurt me by doing things like this. Why would she want to make me feel worse than she already has? Doesn’t she see how broken I am right now? She knew how much I needed her to help get through this, but she chose to go with him anyway. Doesn’t she realize that this hurts me more than anything else? How can she do this to me? She knows exactly how much I love her, and yet she goes ahead and ignores me. This is all so unfair. I don’t know if I can handle this anymore

Triggering Event: A middle-aged woman, her hands chapped from years of washing them raw in the store's restroom, watched as a young cashier struggled to operate the new scanner system for the fifth time that day. She felt her patience wearing thin like an old penny, as she listened to the teenage girl sigh dramatically and mutter under her breath about how "this stupid machine doesn't work." The woman could feel her blood pressure rising with each fruitless beep of the scanner, echoing through the store like a taunting alarm clock at dawn.
Generated Assessment: Oh my god, I'm so fucking mad right now! Like seriously, this poor teenager is trying to do her job but it just won't work. It's such a pain. And then there's this other woman who looks like she's been living off the grid for 20 years, all dry and cracked up like the Sahara desert. Her hands are literally falling off. How does she even manage to get around? It's insane. This whole scene is like some kind of fucked-up nightmare. One minute you're watching someone try to fix a stupid machine that's obviously broken, and the next you're staring at a human being who looks like they've been buried in the sand for decades. It's just too much. We're basically witnessing two extremes here - one is a clumsy teenager struggling with technology, and the other is a desiccated ancient being who refuses to adapt to modern life. These are the only options we have here. You either feel sympathy for the teenager and think, "Man, she's really struggling," or you look at the older woman and think, "Well, she must be getting what she deserves." This isn't some nuanced situation where people exist somewhere in between; no, these two women are either victims or monsters. It's clear-cut. The teenager is innocent, while the elderly woman is just plain cruel. There’s no room for subtlety here. Either way, I am fucking furious.

Triggering Event: A parent calls, worried about their child's falling grades in his class.
Generated Assessment: It's all your fault. I don't even know why you're so upset. You should have done something about it earlier. It's been a long time since he started failing. And now he's really struggling. You need to go back to school and learn how to teach better.

Triggering Event: At the office, he found his old desk replaced with a smaller one against the wall. His colleagues avoided eye contact, whispering as they passed by. An email from HR awaited him: "Performance Improvement Plan Initiated." He felt the familiar tightness in his chest, a heavy sigh escaping him as he looked out at the city, now grayer than before.

If you think I'm going down, then bring it on. I'll take you down too. You're all wrong. I'm the real victim here. You don't understand what I went

Triggering Event: She noticed him again, laughing loudly with colleagues in the lab. He'd been praised for her project idea, his name now attached to it. She felt a bitter taste rise in her throat as she watched him, oblivious to her resentment boiling behind her safety goggles.
Generated Assessment: She was in the lab when he reappeared, his laughter echoing through the room as he discussed his new project with others. Her gaze drifted toward him, but instead of acknowledging him, she forced herself to focus on her work. The sound of his voice lingered in the air, making her stomach churn. What if he asks me to collaborate? I don't want to be involved in his project. If he does ask, what if I agree? Then I'll have to deal with him all the time. But what if he doesn't ask? He’ll just leave, and we’ll both move on. But what if he decides to pursue my idea anyway? It’s probably best if I stop thinking about him. But what if

Triggering Event: A sudden, polite decline from his long-time medical partner during their weekly lunch meeting.
Generated Assessment: Oh my god, it was so much worse than I thought it would be! He had been my best friend for over 20 years, and we always had such great times together. We'd go to this new restaurant every week, just us two, and he'd tell me all about what was going on in his life. It felt like our own little secret club. And now that's gone? I feel like my whole world has been turned upside down. We were at this fancy-schmancy place last time, and I ordered something really expensive because it was special occasion. I don't remember exactly how much it cost, but I think it was over $200. Anyway, after eating, we were getting ready to leave when he suddenly stopped me and said, "Hey, you know what? You're right, we shouldn't have come here today." And then he just walked out. I couldn't believe it. I felt like I'd been punched in the gut. That was our tradition, our thing. Now, I'm left feeling empty, like nothing will ever be the same again. I keep replaying that moment in my head, wondering if there was something wrong with him. Did he not want to hang out anymore? It wasn't until later that day that I realized he hadn't meant anything by it. He explained that he'd been dealing with some personal stuff lately and needed space. But still, the memory lingers, and I can't help

Triggering Event: At 7 AM, she walked into the station, the familiar smell of coffee and old paper doing little to comfort her today. A young officer, barely out of training, approached her with a thick envelope in hand. "Morning, ma'am. This was just delivered for you." She took it, feeling its weight, knowing what it was before she even saw the return address: her late husband's lawyer. As she opened it, a small, worn photograph slipped out - their wedding day. Remorse washed over her like a tidal wave as she remembered that joyful smile, now forever silenced by her decision to keep him from that last call.
Generated Assessment: She sat at home, staring blankly at the wall, unable to shake off the memory of his face when he told her about his final moments. The pain still lingered, but the guilt had become overwhelming, forcing her to confront the truth - she could have saved him if only she'd let him go. Now, every time someone mentioned his name, she felt like a failure, as if she were responsible for his death. The thought haunted her, making her realize that she was more than just an innocent bystander; she was the one who made the choice. It wasn't just about letting him die peacefully; it was about living with the consequences. She couldn't help but wonder how different things would be if only she'd made a different decision, one that would have spared them both. But deep down, she knew the answer was clear - she wouldn't change a thing, because this is where she belonged. The guilt had become her reality, and she couldn't escape it. She didn’t want to be a victim anymore, so she decided to take matters into her own hands.

At 2 AM, he wakes up to his phone buzzing under his pillow. It's an unknown number. He looks at his wife sleeping peacefully beside him. She wouldn't call from an unknown number, would she? His heart races as he steps out onto the balcony, closing the door gently behind him. The message reads: "I know what you did."
